verbs.description: prologuize (third-person singular simple present prologuizes, present participle prologuizing, simple past and past participle prologuized)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To deliver or create a prologue, as for an oration or for a written or musical work.
examples: The place of the prologuizing minstrel is but ill supplied, indeed, by the epistolary dissertations which are prefixed to each book of the present poem.
